page.title: 01Lundy Island-the North.
page.content: Lundy falls into 3 D blocks.For reasons of convenience and space all those things that relate to the ecology of the island are dealt with in this section,as are the children's experiences.Likewise the history and details of tourism are dealt with in the south.The main settlement is in the central section. Lundy lies 11 miles off the North Devon coast.It is owned by the National Trust and run by the Landmark Trust.There is a small resident population and its main industry is tourism-with some farming.The island has a supply ship and a weekly helicopter service. Although only 3 miles long and about half a mile wide there is a wealth of interest,historical and ecological, along with magnificent scenery and peace that is almost total.
